comments.body: is it an error to include a node in FailedNodes and not in this map?

> ...and preemption would not change anything

is that what unresolveable means? the doc doesn't seem to match the variable name

> is it an error to include a node in FailedNodes and not in this map?

No. We are practically considering the union, however nodes in this map don't get considered during preemption.

> > ...and preemption would not change anything
> 
> is that what unresolveable means? the doc doesn't seem to match the variable name

Unresolvable is the term used in the scheduler pkg to indicate that preempting pods from a node doesn't make it schedulable for an incoming pod.

I see. I parsed this as "(Failed Nodes) And (Unresolveable Nodes)" instead of "(Failed And Unresolveable) Nodes". If Unresolveable implies Failed, then would it be clearer to just call this UnresolveableNodes?

this tries to mimic scheduling plugin statuses, which could be "Unschedulable" or "UnschedulableAndUnresolvable".

but I don't have a strong opinion about removing the "Failed" part
if this is following an existing pattern in this API, that's fine
as a serialized API type, this file is strange... it has no json tags, etc... are the scheduler extender APIs being actively expanded?

It is not "actively" expanded per se, I think this is the first update in a very long time. This is an old API, it precedes the involvement of most active members in sig scheduling, we are aware that it misses json tags and proper versioning, there is an open issue to fix that:  #88634
